column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=Polycrystalline powders of Ba0.6K0.4Fe2As2 were prepared by the solid-state reaction.
#Text=Ba pieces, K ingots, Fe powder, and As pieces were used as starting materials.
#Text=In order to compensate the loss of elements, the starting mixture contained 15% excess K and 5% excess As.
#Text=They were mixed in a nitrogen atmosphere more than 10 hour using a ball-milling machine and densely packed into a niobium tube.
#Text=The niobium tube was then put into a stainless steel tube and sealed in nitrogen filled glove box for heat treatment at 900oC for 30 h.
#Text=The surface of the obtained polycrystalline ingot was polished to remove small impurities.
#Text=It was then ground into powder using an agate mortar in nitrogen filled glove box.
#Text=The phase identification of the sample was carried out by means of powder x-ray diffraction (XRD) with Cu-Kα radiation (Smartlab, Rigaku).
#Text=Ground powders were filled in a silver tube with an outer diameter of 4.5 mm and an inner diameter 3 mm, then cold drawn into a square shape with a diagonal dimension of ~1.2 mm.
#Text=After cutting it into short pieces, one of the pieces was put into 1/8 inch copper tube and redrawn down to the diagonal dimension of 1.2 mm.
#Text=Furthermore, a part of the wire was deformed into a tape form with 0.4 mm in thickness.
#Text=After that, both ends of the wires were sealed by using an arc furnace.
#Text=The sealed wires were sintered using the HIP technique.

#Text=Wires and tapes were heated for 4 h at 700oC in argon atmosphere under the pressure of 175 MPa, which were performed by National Institutes for Quantum and Radiological Science and Technology (QST).
#Text=Bulk magnetization was measured by a superconducting quantum interference device (SQUID) magnetometer (MPMS-5XL, Quantum Design).
#Text=Current–voltage (I–V) measurements up to 140 kOe were performed by the four-probe method with solder for contacts.
#Text=A DC electric current up to 100 A was delivered through the wire at a ramping rate of 50–100 A/min.
#Text=Measurements were performed in liquid helium to minimize the effect of Joule heating at the current leads.
#Text=These critical current measurements in high magnetic fields were carried out by using the 15T-SM at High Field Laboratory for Superconducting Materials, IMR, Tohoku University.
#Text=For Magneto-optical (MO) imaging, the PIT wires were cut and the transverse cross sections were polished with lapping films.
#Text=An iron-garnet indicator film was placed in direct contact with the sample and the whole assembly was attached to the cold finger of a He-flow cryostat (Microstat-HR, Oxford Instruments).
#Text=MO images were acquired by using a cooled-CCD camera with 12-bit resolution (ORCA-ER, Hamamatsu).
